item.description:
Great Island Wild Life Management Area.

11:45/12:00, its a distance so i always expect some time variation for travel.

Ok you can join me if you want, im going here to explore the upper portion of the cove/river, its this one area that i havent gone into yet, then later will just enjoy the rest of the day on a sand bar after paddling out on the ocean for a while, maybe even watch the sunset from out in the ocean or island..dont care, either is nice for me

How long: i dont know, when im done exploring, or when its too dark to see and the sharks are biting the back of the kayak.
you can always go back when you want, the launch site isnt too far away...

Rec Kayaks are ok for this paddle.
Flotation bags and a paddle float would be handy for your life but if there are a few of us we can save you pretty easily without that stuff..Not going out to far in the ocean.


Getting there:
Please always check your maps because in the past when writing directions i accidently may leave out something, rarely but it has happend before. .besides you should know some of the side streets and have a mental view of the layout anyway....just in case.

Take rte 9 south all the way down to rte 95.
Take 95 North Exit and go over the CT river bridge,
the first exit on your right is ex# 70 for rte 1 to old lyme
from the exit its 1.8 miles for the right turn onto Smith Neck Rd
Stay on smith neck rd all the way to the end untill you get to the boat ramp.


if you have it bring a light..
Bug Juice and sunscreen.
Food too...sharks and swamp monsters get mighty hungry down there.

I have the blue toyota avalon with a kayak trailer.,

group.who: River and Shore Kayak-r's of CT
group.name: ~~~~HARTFORD COUNTY RIVERS & CT SHORE KAYAK GROUP~~~~ HCR-SK

item.name: Shore Line Paddle Old Lyme CT
